data.title: Guide to the Papers of Robert Andrews Millikan, 1821-1953
data.text:
Radioactivity: Talk to "Western Electricians," Computation of life of radium, and "McCoy's references," October 1903

Record of Data Obtained in Experiments in General Physics, U of C, vol. #2, 1897

Millikan Manuscript: "A Redetermination of the Value of the Electron and Related Constants", 1916

Millikan Manuscript: "New Results on Cosmic Rays," by R A M and G H Cameron

First Draft of Article on Anomalous Dispersion of Electric Waves

"New Proofs of the Kinetic Theory of Matter and the Atomic Theory of Electricity"

Notes Labeled "Valueless Scraps, picked up or thought up while writing article on Anomalous Dispersion of Electric Waves"

National Research Council: Reprint of Letter: G E Hale to N Y Times, July 26, 1916

N A S and N R C as Factors in National Progress: Statement by G E Hale, 1917

Letters of French and German Scientists About World War I, 1922 - 1924

"Report on the Possible Contributions of C I T to the Problem of National Defense," July 1, 1940

Extension of Curriculum of C I T to Five or More Years, 1922 - 1923

GALCIT (Guggenheim Aeronautical Laboratories of C I T), 1945

(Letters Written During Campaign for Funds), 1939 (Part I)

Death of Robert A Millikan: Bequest to the Huntington Library, 1954

Genealogies of the Millikan and Andrews Families

Wills of Greta and Robert A Millikan
